alert.note: Alert for Northern Washington; Southeast Warren; Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 4:28PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Warren and central Washington Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 427 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Comstock, or near Whitehall, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads or flooding in urban and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Hudson Falls, Whitehall, Granville, Hartford, Comstock, Poultney Village, Kingsbury, Mount Hope, Hampton, Fort Ann, Argyle, South Bay, Middle Granville, Braymer School, Dunham Basin, Smiths Basin, Goose Island, Adamsville, North Granville and South Bay Village. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Washington; Southeast Warren; Southern Washington
